definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: When you see the numbers adding up, you’re less likely to overspend.
sentences.chinese: 当你看到数字不断地上升，可能你就不会让其超支。

sentences.english: The annual cost overruns alone equal the government budgets of many nations.
sentences.chinese: 仅每年费用超支一项，就等于许多国家的政府预算额。

sentences.english: The recent advance in application of hyperbranched polymer was reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 对近几年超支化聚合物的应用研究进展进行了综述。

sentences.english: The recent progresses in synthesis and applications of hyperbranched polymers were reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 对近几年超支化聚合物的合成与应用进行了综述。

sentences.english: You don’t overspend in these categories.
sentences.chinese: 你也不会在这些项目上超支。

sentences.english: America vastly overspends on the military compared with other areas of government.
sentences.chinese: 美国在军事上的超支远大于政府的其他方面。

sentences.english: He is assiduously shedding civil servants and wants to fix the procurement process to avoid exorbitant cost overruns.
sentences.chinese: 他努力裁减公务人员并要在军事采购中避免非法超支。

sentences.english: It's through train, you don't have to change anywhere.(＝you don't have to change trains anywhere)
sentences.chinese: 这是一超支达车，你不需要在任何地方换车。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the causes and methods of social medicine overtaking situation of Guangdong Province university.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨广东高校公费医疗超支的原因及对策。

sentences.english: We're a little overspent this month.
sentences.chinese: 这个月我们有点超支了。

sentences.english: Part of compensation for cost overruns are often resolved through consultation.
sentences.chinese: 医保对超支部分的补偿往往通过协商来解决。

sentences.english: The program has been troubled by cost overruns and delays.
sentences.chinese: 该计划一直被费用超支和拖延困扰。

sentences.english: Socialize with friends, but don't overspend on lavish entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 与朋友进行交往，但不要因奢侈款待而超支。

sentences.english: That's because of cost overruns, delays in production.
sentences.chinese: 那要归咎于费用超支和生产延误。

sentences.english: Shopping under pressure leads to overspending.
sentences.chinese: 压力下的采购会导致超支。

sentences.english: It is possible; it's just more difficult. Don't overspend your income, live within it.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能的话，在收入范围内花销，千万不要超支。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
final account/to calculate the final bill/fig. to draw up plans to deal with sth
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
